revised_title: Airborne Radar Observations of Migrant Pests in the United States
tldr: The article discusses the use of airborne radar to detect and study the migration of insect pests, specifically Heliothis zea and Spodoptera frugiperda, from a maize-infested area in the Lower Rio Grande River Valley. The radar system allowed researchers to track the movement and vertical distribution of the insects, providing valuable information for improving pest management strategies in high-value crops.
